alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 2:10PM CDT until May 26 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Major and Woods Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC093-151-153-250715- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0010.000000T0000Z-220526T0600Z/ /WANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 210 PM CDT Tue May 24 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 7.5 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
